title: 'Time UN acted on N Korea'
content: The US undersecretary of state John Bolton said yesterday that it was time to take the North Korean nuclear crisis to the security council: the first step towards UN sanctions. After discussing a range of security issues in Beijing he said he did not sense that China - which has hitherto appeared cool about resorting to the UN - was opposed to taking the issue to the council. "I think it is now timely to bring the matter to the security council and I think we're confident that it could handle both Iraq and North Korea at the same time," he said. He said the International Atomic Energy Agency might issue a third warning to Pyongyang this week, the last step it could take. Mr Bolton said China could have a "profound influence" because of its long friendship with North Korea, and rejected the idea that it had not done enough. "I wouldn't say there's been a failure on the Chinese side at all. I think we're still working on the problem."
